text: Ashland Covered Bridge, also known as Ashland Bridge or Barley Mill Road Covered Bridge, is a covered bridge over Red Clay Creek on Barley Mill Road (near the junction of Brackenville Road) in Ashland in New Castle County, Delaware. == Style == It is a Town lattice truss bridge following a design of Ithiel Town, built about 1860. It is almost identical to the Wooddale Bridge. . == History == In 1965, when it was documented in the Historic American Engineering Record survey, it was one of the last three surviving covered bridges in the state of Delaware. It was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1973. ==See also== * * ==References== ==External links== * Interior lattice work Category:Road bridges on the National Register of Historic Places in Delaware Category:Bridges in New Castle County, Delaware Category:Bridges completed in 1860 Category:Road bridges in Delaware Category:Covered bridges in Delaware Category:Historic American Buildings Survey in Delaware Category:National Register of Historic Places in New Castle County, Delaware Category:Covered bridges on the National Register of Historic Places in Delaware Category:Wooden bridges in the United States Category:Lattice truss bridges in the United States
title: Ashland Covered Bridge
